content:
Please review, try, give some feedback on the new module created for Backdrop https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/activity_calendar Drupal's equivalent on https://www.drupal.org/project/acal uses different library, and it seems abandoned and broken.

backdrop-contrib/activity_calendar
Visualizes users' activity over the yearly calendar. - backdrop-contrib/activity_calendar

Cool! Many thanks for this new module, I'll try to play with it soon.
One hint: you should also give credits to the developers of the external libraries in the README credits section and add info about their license. At least, that's what I usually do.
@indigoxela The library mentioned in the Requirements section, though it's nice point about the Credit section.

https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/activity_calendar/blob/1.x-1.x/README.md#credits

backdrop-contrib/activity_calendar
Visualizes users' activity over the yearly calendar. - backdrop-contrib/activity_calendar
Perfect! And so quick... :smiley:
Ooops, typo: "eveloped", but no need to rush.

indigoxela said:

Ooops, typo: "eveloped", but no need to rush.

My bad. Fixed.
Cool! Curious why GPL-3.0 though?

Laryn said:

Cool! Curious why GPL-3.0 though?

Just choose because it seemed newer, maybe up-to-dated version. Never reserached the difference between 2 and 3. Any recommendations for Backdrop contrib modules? Should they be uploaded under version 2?
I think the recommendation is "GPL-2.0 or later" unless it is necessary to do "GPL-3.0" because of bundled license compatibility.

https://github.com/backdrop-ops/contrib#new-project-checklist

backdrop-ops/contrib
Apply to join the contributed code developer team. - backdrop-ops/contrib
GPL3 contrib modules apparently have no chance of ever being merged into core.

I thought GPL-3.0 is considered "later" and was attributing it to several other contrib modules. Now after seeing your and @BWPanda's comment on this, I will have to change them all to DPL-2 Thanks for noting!

Have just updated the License.txt file by replacing the text to GPL v.2 and now I have this discrepancy on top of the page: Screenshot-from-2021-01-29-17-36-33.png Probably, it's a GitHub bug - not being able to update the License text without completely deleting and re-creating it choosing another one.
New version is rolled out with the user activity block added.

@Alan Mels - Just for fun, I added the Activity Calendar module to the survey site. The user activity block is enabled on user pages and all authenticated users are able to view user profiles.

The user activity calendar tracks "adding feature ideas" and "comments." I don't think it supports tracking FLAGS as a user activity, which is what we are using for voting.
If anyone wants to see the Activity Calendar module in action, create an account on https://survey.backdropcms.org/

@StPaulTim Thanks! In fact, I decided to come up with this module, because I wanted to track user activity for translating Backdrop to Russian language on Backdrop.ru. But then tracking nodes and comments was the obvious features. However, eventually I'd like to make an API so other modules can track anything they want - translations, voting, etc
@StPaulTim Also it's better to put the block as shown on https://www.backdrop.ru. If you use the last version of the module it also comes with user activity block
Whose activity is being shown for anonymous users?

@StPaulTim I believe you are on outdated dev, because https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/activity_calendar/issues/1 had already been resolved, but on https://survey.backdropcms.org I see the nav buttons even if I had not entries a year ago. So please download the latest version.

Remove nav buttons if no previous years · Issue #1 · backdrop-contrib/activity_calendar
Otherwise, they look strange on a new Backdrop website:

oadaeh (Jason Flatt) said:

Whose activity is being shown for anonymous users?

https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/activity_calendar/issues/4

Limit views access for the module block to only registered users · Issue #4 · backdrop-contrib/activity_calendar
subj. because the block is useless for anonymous users.
@oadaeh (Jason Flatt) I know the visibility can be controlled on the block settings, but I'd like to prevent it from showing to anonymous users at all.
That makes sense.

@StPaulTim Also it's better to put the block as shown on https://www.backdrop.ru.

Done @Alan Mels
Thanks @Alan Mels for your work on this module and for adding the "flag activity" feature.
